com.sleepDiary.backend.aws

Class SimpleDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sleepDiary.backend.aws.SimpleDB

  • public class SimpleDB
extends java.lang.Object
    Support API to write data into AWS - Create users - Check existing users - Write data into AWS - Aggregate data of a single user
    Author:
    sunil

    • Method Detail

      • userExists

        public static DBCodes userExists(java.lang.String userName)
        Verifies if the userName exists in AWS Must be noted that this should be used only for the uniqueID which is de-identified. No personal information should be reflected in any part of the userName. This will act as a key to data in RedCap
        Parameters:
        userName - user name / unique id of the subject
        Returns:
        DBCodes USER_EXISTS - ID is present USER_NOT_EXISTS - ID doesnt exist in AWS DOMAIN_CREATION_FAILED - If the connector could not be initialized
        See Also:
        Contains definitions of possible status codes

      • createUser

        public static DBCodes createUser(RedCapRecord userDetails)
        Create a new user and pushes the details into both AWS and RedCap
        Parameters:
        userDetails - user information marshalled into RedCapRecord Object
        Returns:
        DBCodes DATA_CORRUPT - RedCapRecord is not complete USER_EXISTS - If the user is already present. DOMAIN_CREATION_FAILED - If the connector could not be initialized USER_ADDED - User has been added to both USER_NOT_ADDED - If addition fails to AWS USER_RED_CAP_ERROR - If addition fails to RedCap
        See Also:
        Contains definitions of possible status codes

      • commitData

        public static DBCodes commitData(java.lang.String userName,
                 UnitData tupleData)
        Write user data into AWS.
        Parameters:
        userDetails - username for the subject
        tupleData - Single unit of data captured to be written into DB
        Returns:
        DBCodes DATA_CORRUPT - UnitData is not complete USER_EXISTS - If the user is already present. DOMAIN_CREATION_FAILED - If the connector could not be initialized DATA_ADDED - Data has been added to AWS DATA_NOT_ADDED - Data addition fails to AWS
        See Also:
        Contains definitions of possible status codes

      • getUserNames

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUserNames()
        Get a list of all users existing in the data base
        Parameters:
        void -
        Returns:
        null if the domain doesnt exist then there are no users that are present

      • getUserDetails

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getUserDetails(java.lang.String userName)
        Get all entries of a particular user
        Parameters:
        userName - user name of the subject
        Returns:
        userdetails First row are the headers, the remaining rows contain tuple Data
